alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 12:40PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON... NORTHEASTERN ALLEGANY AND NORTHERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 1235 PM EST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from near Fort Loudon to Inglesmith. Movement was east at 45 mph. A period of moderate to heavy snow showers will combine with strong winds to cause visibilities to briefly drop below a half mile and produce locally heavy snow up to one inch. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. Locations impacted include... Hagerstown, Hancock, Fountainhead-Orchard Hills, Paramount-Long Meadow, Wilson-Conococheague, Williamsport, Berkeley Springs, Long Meadow, Halfway, Maugansville, Falling Waters, Great Cacapon, Clear Spring, Pecktonville, Big Spring, Big Pool, Middleburg, Little Orleans, Johnsons Mill and Warrenton. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
